alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 738 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - There are several reports of ramp closures and lane disruptions on I-95. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Narberth, National Park, East Lansdowne, Drexel Hill, Darby Township, Broomall, and Philadelphia International Airport. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 338...and between mile markers 341 and 351. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
